definition: to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)

mark/sign/label/to mark with a symbol, label, lettering etc/to bear (a brand name, registration number etc)/prize/award/bid/target/quota/(old) the topmost branches of a tree/visible symptom/classifier for military units
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately

sentences.english: Their personality publicity, Zhuo without Kwan, seeking means of differentiating itself.
sentences.chinese: 她們個性張揚，卓而不羣，追求標新立異。

sentences.english: The author seems to strain after novelty.
sentences.chinese: 作者似乎在力圖標新立異。

sentences.english: To always negate is not the way to create what is new and original.
sentences.chinese: 一味的否定並非就是標新立異。

definition: to have a unique style of one's own (idiom)
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
not the least bit concerned/completely indifferent
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
universally shocking/to offend the whole of society
lit. to build a cart behind closed doors/to be overly subjective and disregard the outside world (idiom)
to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
